original: brjod pa / ci kho bo cag gis yod bzhin par gyur pa dbang po gzugs can dag gis gzung du med do zhes de @127b skad du smras sam /ğŸ”½'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa / ci kho bo cag gis yod bzhin par gyur pa dbang po gzugs can dag gis gzung du med do zhes de @127b skad du smras sam / 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Response: Do we say that what exists is not apprehended by physical sense faculties?ğŸ”½If not, what do we say?

original: kho bo cag ni /ğŸ”½tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni / tshogs la gzung du yod rigs na //
translated: We say:ğŸ”½If it is reasonable that the effect exists in the assembly,

original: zhes spyir smra'o //
analyzed: zhes spyir smra'o //
translated: then it would be generally said that the effect exists in the assembly.

analyzed: bye ma dag las 'bru mar bzhin no //

translated: and therefore the effect exists in the assembly because of inference,

original: brjod pa / gang zhig gang na yod pa de ni de las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa / gang zhig gang na yod pa de ni de las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: we say: This inference that if something exists in something else, it is not produced from it,

original: dper na khar gzhong las zho mi skye ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa 'di las de yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir tshogs pa 'bras bu med pa nyid do zhes ci ste mi gzung /
analyzed: dper na khar gzhong las zho mi skye ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpag pa 'di las de yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir tshogs pa 'bras bu med pa nyid do zhes ci ste mi gzung /
translated: like yogurt is not produced from a clay pot, is unreasonable because it is not logical that the effect exists in the assembly. Therefore why not accept that the assembly is devoid of the effect?

original: ci ste yang phyogs gnyi ga yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir na ji ltar yod pa nyid mi rigs pa de bzhin du med pa nyid kyang mi rigs so snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang phyogs gnyi ga yang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir na ji ltar yod pa nyid mi rigs pa de bzhin du med pa nyid kyang mi rigs so snyam na /
translated: But if you think that since both positions are contradicted by inference, then just as existence is not tenable, so too nonexistence is not tenable,

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: we reply:

original: kho bo cag ni 'di med par sgrub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'di med par sgrub pa ma yin gyi /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis yod pa nyid du yongs su brtags pa 'gog pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du kho bo cag ni 'di yod pa nyid du sgrub pa ma yin te /

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: 'di gzhan gyis med pa nyid du brtags pa sel ba yin te /

original: brgya ba las kyang /
analyzed: brgya ba las kyang /

translated: Exists or does not exist in the conditions,

analyzed: khyim gyi don du ka ba la //
translated: The ornament of the house,

analyzed: sogs pa'i rgyan ni don med 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bshad do //
translated: And so on, would be pointless.

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na tshogs pa las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin te /

analyzed: ci ste tshogs pa la 'bras bu med pa nyid do snyam du sems na de lta na yang / gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //

translated: and therefore they are not its causes,

analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa brjod par 'dod pa rnams kyang rgyu dang rkyen nyid du mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: tshogs pa la ni 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa med do //

original: gzhan yang / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //

analyzed: de lta na yang / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //

analyzed: rgyu ma byin par 'gag 'gyur na // rgyu 'gags nas ni skyes pa yi //
translated: Without giving its causal power to the effect,ğŸ”½Then the effect that arises from the ceased cause

analyzed: rgyu med pa ni yod pa ma yin pas rtog pa 'di ni mi rigs so // 'dir smras pa /
translated: But since that which is without a cause does not exist, this conception is illogical.

analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rgyu las skye bas nyes pa 'dir 'gyur na ni //

analyzed: rtog pa 'di yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i @128b phyir ; gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //
translated: To demonstrate that this conception is also untenable, it is said:ğŸ”½If the effect arises

analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na // skyed par byed dang bskyed bya gang //
translated: simultaneously with the collection,ğŸ”½then the absurd consequence would follow

original: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur /ğŸ”½zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dus gcig par ni thal bar 'gyur / zhes gsungs te /
translated: that the generator and the generated would be simultaneous.

analyzed: ba glang gi rva g-yas g-yon dus gcig pa dag ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid du yang ma mthong bas /

original: 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: so this is untenable.

original: 'dir kha cig na re /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig na re /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po rnams ma byung ba las skye ba ni med de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ma byung ba las skye ba ni med de /
translated: â€œThings do not arise from what has not occurred,

analyzed: glo bur bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshogs pas ni ma yin la /

analyzed: bshad zin pa'i nyes par thal ba yang ma yin te /

analyzed: la te rgyu 'gags 'bras bu na //

analyzed: rgyu ni kun du 'pho bar 'gyur //

original: de lta yin na ni /ğŸ”½rgyu ni @129a * //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni / rgyu ni @129a * //

analyzed: zlos gar mkhan cha byad gzhan btang nas cha byad gzhan len pa ltar rgyu 'pho ba tsam zhig tu 'gyur gyi /

original: de'i phyir rgyu rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na /

translated: As it says in Catuhfi sÌataka:ğŸ”½That which does not existğŸ”½Without depending on something else at any time,

original: des na nam yang gang zhig tu //
analyzed: des na nam yang gang zhig tu //

original: rtag pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: rtag pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //

original: gzhan yang rtog pa 'di la ni /

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car med pa'i phyir dang / yod zin pa la phrad pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag cig car med pa'i phyir dang / yod zin pa la phrad pa don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a cause and an effect do not occur simultaneously, and because it is meaningless for that which already exists to make contact.

original: yod pa phan tshun ltos pa med pa dag la ni yang phrad pas dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: yod pa phan tshun ltos pa med pa dag la ni yang phrad pas dgos pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: What purpose is there for that which exists to make mutual contact, since it is independent of the other?

original: de'i phyir phrad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contact.

original: da ni ji ltar 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yang rgyu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yang rgyu 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how a future effect does not make mutual contact with a past, future, or present cause, the root text states:ğŸ”½An unarisen effect does not make mutual contact with an arisen,

original: 'bras bu ma skyes rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes rgyu skyes dang // ma skyes pa dang 'das pa dang // lhan cig phrad par 'gyur ba ni //
translated: unarisen, or past cause.

original: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It never exists.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni med pa yin la /ğŸ”½de ni rgyu dus tha dad pa dang da ltar ba dang 'das pa dang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa ni med pa yin la / de ni rgyu dus tha dad pa dang da ltar ba dang 'das pa dang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The effect that has not yet arisen is nonexistent.

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not make contact with the cause that is in a different time, that is present, or that is past, because they are in different times.

original: rgyu ma 'ongs pa dang yang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma 'ongs pa dang yang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The future cause also does not make contact with the effect that is present,

original: gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are nonexistent.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar rnam pa thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When in this way the cause and effect never make contact in any way,

original: phrad pa yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa ma yin na //
translated: then, since contact does not exist,

original: @131a * // rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed //ğŸ”½phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu mi bskyed pa nyid de /
analyzed: @131a * // rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed // phrad pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu mi bskyed pa nyid de /
translated: how could the cause generate the effect?

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since contact does not exist, the cause does not generate the effect, just like the son of a barren woman.

original: ci ste yang phrad pa yod pa nyid yin dang / rgyus 'bras bu bskyed do snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang phrad pa yod pa nyid yin dang / rgyus 'bras bu bskyed do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that contact exists and the cause generates the effect,

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is not logical,

original: dus gsum char du yang phrad pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum char du yang phrad pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact is not observed in any of the three times.

original: ci ste yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ci zhig ltar phrad par rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste yang rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ci zhig ltar phrad par rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that the cause and effect contact each other in some way,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case as well,

original: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang /
analyzed: phrad pa yod pa yin na yang /
translated: even if contact exists,

original: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed de /
analyzed: rgyus ni 'bras bu ji ltar bskyed de /
translated: how could the cause generate the effect?

original: 'bras bu lhan cig pa yang skye ba don med pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig ma yin pa rnams kyang phrad par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu lhan cig pa yang skye ba don med pa'i phyir dang / lhan cig ma yin pa rnams kyang phrad par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because it is pointless for the effect to be generated simultaneously with the cause, and because it is illogical for those that are not simultaneous to contact each other.ğŸ”½Moreover,

original: gzhan yang // gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i rgyus //
analyzed: gzhan yang // gal te 'bras bus stong pa'i rgyus //
translated: If the cause is empty of the effect,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: how could the cause generate the effect?

original: gal te 'bras bus mi stong rgyus //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bus mi stong rgyus //
translated: If the cause is not empty of the effect,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par byed //
translated: how could the cause generate the effect?

original: rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'dod pa de des stong pa zhig gam mi stong pa zhig gis 'bras bu skyed par byed grang /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu skyed par byed par 'dod pa de des stong pa zhig gam mi stong pa zhig gis 'bras bu skyed par byed grang /
translated: If you assert that a cause generates an effect, is it a cause that is empty of the effect or not empty of the effect that generates the effect?

original: de la 'bras bus stong zhing bral ba'i rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de la 'bras bus stong zhing bral ba'i rgyus ni 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
translated: A cause devoid of and separated from an effect does not generate an effect,

original: rgyu ma yin pa ltar 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ltar 'bras bus stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of an effect, like what is not a cause.

original: 'bras bus mi stong pa'i rgyus kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bus mi stong pa'i rgyus kyang 'bras bu skyed par mi byed de /
translated: A cause not devoid of an effect also does not generate an effect,

original: yod pa'i phyir bu yod pa'i lha sbyin bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bu yod pa'i lha sbyin bzhin no //
translated: because it exists, like Devadatta who has a son.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: re zhig 'bras bus stong pa'am mi stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bus stong pa'am mi stong pa'i rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: a cause that is devoid of an effect or not devoid of an effect does not generate an effect.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig skye ba de yang mi stong pa'am stong pa zhig bskyed grang //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skye ba de yang mi stong pa'am stong pa zhig bskyed grang //
translated: Moreover, that effect which arises is either devoid or not devoid.

original: de la / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de la / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur //
translated: An effect that is not devoid does not arise,

original: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi stong 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and that which is not devoid does not cease.ğŸ”½That which is not devoid would be unceased

original: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mi stong de ni ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: and also unarisen.

original: 'bras bu mi stong pa ni rten cing 'brel par ma byung zhing rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi stong pa ni rten cing 'brel par ma byung zhing rang bzhin gyis rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: An effect that is not devoid is not dependently arisen and is intrinsically real.

original: 'bras bu rnam par gnas pa de lta bu de ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par gnas pa de lta bu de ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: That effect, which is such that it abides, would not arise.

original: rang bzhin la ldog pa med pas 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ldog pa med pas 'gag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because there is no reversal of the nature of things, it would not cease.

original: de'i phyir de mi stong par 'dod pa na mi skye ba dang mi 'gag par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi stong par 'dod pa na mi skye ba dang mi 'gag par gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if you assert that it is not empty, then it would not arise and it would not cease.

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not asserted.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu de mi stong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu de mi stong pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, that effect is not not empty,

original: skye ba dang 'gag par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½da ni 'bras bu stong pa de yang @131b yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // da ni 'bras bu stong pa de yang @131b yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because its arising and ceasing are accepted.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that that empty effect also does not exist, because it follows that it would neither arise nor cease,ğŸ”½it is said:

original: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: How could the empty arise?

original: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: How could the empty cease?ğŸ”½The empty would also follow as unceased

original: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa de yang ma 'gags dang // ma skyes par yang thal bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and unarisen.

original: de la stong pa ni gang rang bzhin gyis med pa la brjod la /
analyzed: de la stong pa ni gang rang bzhin gyis med pa la brjod la /
translated: There, the empty is said to be that which is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis med pa de ni ji ltar skye ba'am 'gag par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis med pa de ni ji ltar skye ba'am 'gag par 'gyur te ;
translated: How could that which is essentially nonexistent arise or cease?

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis med pa la ni skye ba'am 'jig pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis med pa la ni skye ba'am 'jig pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: The essentially nonexistent, such as space, is not seen to arise or cease.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu de stong par 'dod pa na yang ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu de stong par 'dod pa na yang ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if you assert that the effect is empty, it follows that it is neither arisen nor ceased.

original: gzhan yang / gal te rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na //ğŸ”½de 'bras bu las tha dad pa'am //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te rgyu gang zhig 'bras bu skyed par byed pa na // de 'bras bu las tha dad pa'am //
translated: Moreover, if a cause generates an effect,

original: tha mi dad pa zhig gis bskyed grang na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa zhig gis bskyed grang na /
translated: is it generated by a cause that is different from the effect orğŸ”½by one that is not different from the effect?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Both are untenable.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni //
translated: The statement,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid du //
translated: The identity of cause and effect

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is never tenable.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid du //
translated: The difference of cause and effect

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is never tenable.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is what is being referred to.

original: 'di ni dam bca' ba tsam zhig yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dam bca' ba tsam zhig yin te /
translated: This is just a thesis.

original: ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is it established?ğŸ”½In order to demonstrate this,

original: bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid na //
translated: If cause and effect were the same,

original: bskyed bya skyed byed gcig tu 'gyur //
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed gcig tu 'gyur //
translated: then the produced and producer would be the same.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid na //
translated: If cause and effect were different,

original: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu min mtshungs par 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: then cause and noncause would be equivalent.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid yin na ni /
translated: If cause and effect were the same,

original: de'i tshe bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa gnyis gcig pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa gnyis gcig pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur na /
translated: then the produced and producer would be the same.

original: de gnyis ni gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin te pha dang bu dang mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dag kyang gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gcig pa nyid kyang ma yin te pha dang bu dang mig dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dag kyang gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But these two are not the same, because it follows that father and son and eye and eye consciousness would be the same.

original: de lta na re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu la gcig nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu la gcig nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first cause and effect are not the same.

original: da ni gzhan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /ğŸ”½ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: da ni gzhan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Now they are not different,

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan nyid yin na ni /
translated: because if cause and effect were different,ğŸ”½then cause and noncause would be equivalent.

original: de'i tshe gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu la ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gyur na ;
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir 'bras bu rgyu la ltos pa med pa nyid du 'gyur na ;
translated: At that time, because it does not depend on another, the effect would not depend on the cause.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la gzhan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½gang dag la de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la gzhan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no // gang dag la de ltar rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: Therefore, cause and effect do not exist as different.ğŸ”½Those that do not exist as identical or different

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni nam yang bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /ğŸ”½de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu @132a * //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni nam yang bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te / de'i phyir rgyus 'bras bu @132a * //
translated: are never the entities of that which is produced and that which produces.

original: bskyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause does not produce the effect.

original: gzhan yang gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na /ğŸ”½des 'bras bu de ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rgyus 'bras bu skyed par byed na / des 'bras bu de ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa'am /
translated: Moreover, if the cause produces the effect,

original: med pa zhig bskyed /
analyzed: med pa zhig bskyed /
translated: does it produce the effect that exists by virtue of its own nature orğŸ”½does it produce the effect that does not exist by virtue of its own nature?

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /ğŸ”½gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so zhes gsungs pa ni 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod na rgyus ni ci zhig bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na / gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so zhes gsungs pa ni 'bras bu ngo bo nyid yod na rgyus ni ci zhig bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: What is wrong with that?ğŸ”½It is said that it is illogical in both cases: If the effect exists, what is the cause?

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If the effect does not exist, what is the cause?

original: rgyus ni ci zhig bskyed par 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyus ni ci zhig bskyed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What would a cause generate?

original: de la 'bras bu gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa rang bzhin gyis bdog pa de ni yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu gang zhig ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa rang bzhin gyis bdog pa de ni yang mi skye ste /
translated: In that regard, any effect that exists by way of its own intrinsic reality, that intrinsically exists, is not generated again,

original: yod pa'i phyir bum pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir bum pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: because it exists, like a vase that already exists.

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis med pa gang yin pa de yang rgyus bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis med pa gang yin pa de yang rgyus bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, any effect that does not exist by way of its own intrinsic reality is not generated by a cause,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: because it does not intrinsically exist, like the horn of an ass.

original: gal te gzugs brnyan gyis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs brnyan gyis ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is not established because it is like a reflection,

original: ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur mod /
translated: then it is not established.

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par ni grub bo //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par ni grub bo //
translated: But things are established as lacking intrinsic existence.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin du smra ba btang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin du smra ba btang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, the proponents of intrinsic existence are refuted,

original: kho bo cag smra ba'i rjes su smra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag smra ba'i rjes su smra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: and we are the ones who speak in accordance with the way things are.

original: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa 'ga' yang med pas 'gal zla med pa'i phyir dngos po rang bzhin med pa yang med de /
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin dang bcas pa 'ga' yang med pas 'gal zla med pa'i phyir dngos po rang bzhin med pa yang med de /
translated: Since there are no things that possess intrinsic nature, there are also no things that lack intrinsic nature because there is no contradiction.

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be indeterminate?

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi ltar na ni gzugs brnyan rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi ltar na ni gzugs brnyan rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin zhing /
translated: In this way, for us, a reflection does not have intrinsic reality,

original: rang bzhin med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it without intrinsic reality.

original: chos can med na de'i chos dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can med na de'i chos dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the subject does not exist, its attributes also do not exist.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba cung zad cig rang bzhin dang rang bzhin med par gzigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba cung zad cig rang bzhin dang rang bzhin med par gzigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The noble ones do not see anything called a reflection as having intrinsic reality or as being without intrinsic reality.

original: de la sngar ni /ğŸ”½'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de la sngar ni / 'bras bu mi stong skye mi 'gyur /
translated: Previously,ğŸ”½in two verses beginning with â€œA nonempty effect does not arise,â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis dngos su 'bras bu skye ba'i byed pa po nyid yin pa bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis dngos su 'bras bu skye ba'i byed pa po nyid yin pa bkag pa yin la /
translated: the direct agent of the arising of an effect is refuted.

original: de lta ni rgyus 'bras bu skye ba'i bya ba'i rab tu sbyor bar byed pa po nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gong ma las 'di'i khyad par yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o /
analyzed: de lta ni rgyus 'bras bu skye ba'i bya ba'i rab tu sbyor bar byed pa po nyid yin pa bkag pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gong ma las 'di'i khyad par yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o /
translated: Here, the indirect agent of the arising of an effect is refuted. This should be understood as the difference between this and the previous chapter.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gal te yang rgyu 'bras bu skye ba'i bya ba'i rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid yin pa bkag mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu 'bras bu skye ba'i bya ba'i rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid yin pa bkag mod kyi /
translated: Although you have refuted the cause being the appropriator of the action of giving rise to the effect,

original: de lta na yang re zhig rgyu ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang re zhig rgyu ni rang bzhin gyis yod pa yin la /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod par 'gyur ro //

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: rgyu nyid 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ci ste de ltar rgyu'i rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yod pas rgyu yang yod par 'gyur ro snyam na /

analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu yang med do //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: but also

analyzed: gal te skyed par byed pa zhig yin no zhes rtog na ni de mi rung ste /

analyzed: bdag gi dngos po rnyed pa ni yang bdag nyid bskyed pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs te /

analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pas rang gi bdag nyid mi skyed la /

original: ces gsungs te /

analyzed: rgyu rnams dang rkyen dag gi tshogs pa gang yin pa de re zhig bdag gis bdag nyid mi skyed de /

analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bdag nyid skyed par mi nus pas bu skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mi rigs so //

analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung ba med par med // ces gsungs te /

original: 'jig pa rnam par 'jig pa ni 'byung ba med par ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig pa rnam par 'jig pa ni 'byung ba med par ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur /

original: ji lta bur na zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan mi srid par grags pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bur na zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtan mi srid par grags pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase â€œin what way?â€ indicates that it is well known that this is utterly impossible.

original: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta bur na yod par 'gyur te /

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist. This is the intended meaning.

original: yang gal te 'byung ba med par 'jig pa yod par 'gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te 'byung ba med par 'jig pa yod par 'gyur na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, if destruction existed without an origin, what would be the error?

original: brjod pa / skye ba med par 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brjod pa / skye ba med par 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: We respond: Without origination, there would be death.

original: ma skyes pa 'chi bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa 'chi bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the unborn died,

original: ma skyes par ni 'chi bar yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes par ni 'chi bar yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: we would not see the unborn dying.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod par mi 'os so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa 'byung ba med par yod par mi 'os so //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that destruction exists without an origin.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed gong mas ni dam bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed gong mas ni dam bcas pa yin la /
translated: Here the first half of the verse is the thesis.

original: rkang pa bar mas ni thal ba bsgrubs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rkang pa bar mas ni thal ba bsgrubs pa yin zhing /
translated: The middle verse line establishes the absurd consequence.

original: thams ni mjug bsdus pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thams ni mjug bsdus pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The last line is the conclusion. This is how you should understand it.

original: de ltar re zhig 'byung ba med par 'jig par mi rigs so zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'byung ba med par 'jig par mi rigs so zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first, it has been demonstrated that it does not make sense for destruction to exist without an origin.

original: de ni 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: As such, it is taught that destruction does not exist simultaneously with emergence.

original: 'jig pa 'byung dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung dang lhan cig tu //
translated: As for that, it has been demonstrated that destruction does not exist simultaneously with emergence.

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //ğŸ”½'chi ba skye dang dus gcig tu //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // 'chi ba skye dang dus gcig tu //
translated: How could destruction existğŸ”½Simultaneously with emergence?

original: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Death and birth do not exist

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Simultaneously.

original: gal te 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu ste dus gcig tu cig car yod par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu ste dus gcig tu cig car yod par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If destruction existed simultaneously with emergence, that is, at the same time,

original: de ltar na 'chi ba dang skye ba dus gcig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'chi ba dang skye ba dus gcig par 'gyur na /
translated: then death and birth would occur at the same time.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba de gnyis ni snang ba dang mun pa ltar dus gcig gi tshe yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba de gnyis ni snang ba dang mun pa ltar dus gcig gi tshe yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But these two mutually exclusive states do not exist at the same time, like light and darkness.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang lhan cig tu yang grub pa yod pa ma yin no @134b zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that destruction does not exist simultaneously with emergence.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar 'jig pa 'byung ba med par ram /
translated: When it is like this, destruction does not exist without emergence.

analyzed: lhan cig tu yang grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par ram / lhan cig tu grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as emergence does not exist without destruction, nor does it exist simultaneously with it,ğŸ”½so too, destruction does not exist without emergence, nor does it exist simultaneously with it.ğŸ”½

original: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: Just as emergence does not exist without destruction, nor does it exist simultaneously, in the same way, emergence does not exist without destruction, nor does it exist simultaneously.ğŸ”½To explain this, it is said:

analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur // dngos po rnams la mi rtag nyid //
translated: How could emergence existğŸ”½without destruction?ğŸ”½Impermanence

original: nam yang med pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nam yang med pa ma yin no // zhes gsungs so //
translated: never does not exist for things.

original: 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par mi rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni 'jig pa med par mi rigs pa nyid de /

original: gang gi phyir dngos po 'byung ba'i chos can skye ba'i chos can rnams la mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po 'byung ba'i chos can skye ba'i chos can rnams la mi rtag pa nyid nam yang med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because impermanence never does not exist for things that have the property of emergence and the property of arising.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, â€œWell then, what is it?â€

original: thams cad kyi tshe yod pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe yod pa yin te /
translated: It exists at all times.ğŸ”½It is explained:

original: dngos po thams cad dus kun du //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dus kun du //
translated: All things

original: rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi ba'i chos yin na //
translated: are the phenomena of aging and death.ğŸ”½What thing exists

original: gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //ğŸ”½gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //ğŸ”½zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang dag rga dang 'chi med par //ğŸ”½gnas pa'i dngos po gang zhig yin //ğŸ”½zhes bshad do //
translated: that is not subject to aging and death?

original: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po thams cad rtag tu mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel pa de'i tshe gang 'jig pa dang bral bar gyur ba'i /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar dngos po thams cad rtag tu mi rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel pa de'i tshe gang 'jig pa dang bral bar gyur ba'i /
translated: When in this way all things are always related to impermanence, then what is free from disintegration?

original: gnas skabs de 'ga' yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gnas skabs de 'ga' yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When all things are always related to impermanence, then how could there be any occasion that is free from destruction?

analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa med par 'byung ba srid pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, without destruction, emergence is not possible.

original: de ltar na re zhig 'byung ba 'jig pa med par yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'byung ba 'jig pa med par yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Thus, first, emergence does not exist without destruction.

analyzed: ;'di dag gi dpyad pa lhag ma ni 'dus byas brtag par dpyad zin pa'i phyir yang rnam par mi dpyad do //
translated: Since the remaining analysis of these has already been analyzed in the examination of the produced, it will not be analyzed here.

analyzed: gang zhig 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin te /

translated: Having stated the proof, if someone responds by saying that it is not certain because of the characteristics of the final mind and mental factors, then that person would be speaking nonsensically.

original: de'i 'jig pa yang skye ba'i rkyen can yin pa nyid kyis rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i 'jig pa yang skye ba'i rkyen can yin pa nyid kyis rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since its destruction is also conditioned by arising, it has a cause, and since it is similar to what is to be established,

original: ma nges pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not indeterminate.

original: gang yang dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni ma byung ba las byung ba skye ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni ma byung ba las byung ba skye ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the intrinsic reality of things is called â€œarisingâ€ because it arises from what was not previously existent.

translated: Therefore, since it is established that things that substantially exist arise, they are not like the example, even conventionally.ğŸ”½But that is not correct, because you accept that things that lack substantial existence, such as reflections,

analyzed: med pa rnams rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ji skad du //ğŸ”½gang dag rgyu las 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas ji skad du // gang dag rgyu las 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: As the master NÄgÄrjuna said:ğŸ”½Whatever arises from a cause

original: gang dag de med pas med pa //
analyzed: gang dag de med pas med pa //
translated: And whatever does not exist without a cause,ğŸ”½The Sage said that it arises like a reflection

original: de dag gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par //ğŸ”½gsal ba ji lta bur me bzhed //
analyzed: de dag gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par //ğŸ”½gsal ba ji lta bur me bzhed //

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du dpe ma grub pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du dpe ma grub pa ga la yod /
translated: Thus, how can it be said that the example is not established conventionally?

original: gal te yang gang dngos po las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par mi nus pa de ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin no zhes smra na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang gang dngos po las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par mi nus pa de ni kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin no zhes smra na ni /
translated: If you say that whatever cannot be said to be the same or different from a thing does not exist even conventionally,

analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzugs kyi dngos po ming tsam phyir //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dngos po ming tsam phyir //
translated: Because the entity of form is mere name,

original: nam mkha' yang ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ni ming tsam mo //
translated: even space is mere name.

original: 'byung med gzugs lta ga la yod //
analyzed: 'byung med gzugs lta ga la yod //
translated: How can there be form without the elements?

original: de'i phyir ming tsam nyid kyang yin //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming tsam nyid kyang yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is mere name.

original: gzhan yang gang gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par skye bar 'gyur ba /
translated: Moreover, the special state of arising

analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams la ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could it be the intrinsic reality of things for the MÄdhyamikas?

analyzed: de'i phyir dpe ma grub par brjod pa ni mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to say that the example is not established.

original: gang yang 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de skad smra ba de la ni gtan tshigs 'dis 'gal ba chen po 'dren pa yin no //
translated: But this argument leads to a great contradiction for the person who maintains that.

analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs 'dis 'jig pa la rgyu med par sgrub par byed pa de ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang sgrub par byed do //
translated: Just as this argument proves that destruction is without cause, it also proves that the characteristic of the conditioned does not exist.

translated: In the same way, it contradicts everything that is included in the aggregate of formation, included in the members of dependent origination, and so on. Therefore this is not reasonable.

analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ni yul gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, consciousness does not discern the intrinsic nature of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad bkag pa'i phyir 'di la mi 'dod pa chen po grub par 'gyur bas 'di gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad bkag pa'i phyir 'di la mi 'dod pa chen po grub par 'gyur bas 'di gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Since all of these are refuted, this great unwanted consequence is established for you, so do not grasp it!

analyzed: da ni ji ltar 'byung ba 'jig pa dang lhan cig grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir / 'byung ba 'jig dang @135b lhan cig tu //

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: and destruction exist together?

original: skye ba 'chi dang dus gcig tu //
analyzed: skye ba 'chi dang dus gcig tu //
translated: Birth and death

original: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni ma yin no // zhes gsungs te /
translated: do not exist at the same time.

original: gal te 'byung ba 'jig pa dang lhan cig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba 'jig pa dang lhan cig yod par gyur na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba dang 'chi bdag dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur na srid pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: ci ste skye ba dang 'chi ba dag lhan cig gi ngo bo 'am tha dad pa'i ngo bor grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod de /
translated: But if arising and cessation are not established as having the same or different natures, then becoming and destruction exist,

original: brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin no snyam na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bzhin no snyam na /
translated: because they are objects of expression, like consciousness.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba nyid kyis de dag grub par 'dod na ni /

analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu yang 'dod par bya'o // gzhan yang / gang dag phan tshun lhan cig gam / phan tshun lhan cig ma yin par //
translated: then you should assert that the son of a barren woman exists.ğŸ”½Moreover:ğŸ”½Those that are not established

original: grub pa yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: grub pa yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: as simultaneous or not simultaneous,

original: de dag grub pa ji ltar yod //
analyzed: de dag grub pa ji ltar yod //
translated: how could they be established?

analyzed: gang las 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag 'grub par 'gyur ba lhan cig pa nyid dang lhan cig pa nyid ma yin pa las ma gtogs pa phyogs gzhan ni med do //
translated: Apart from being simultaneous or not simultaneous, there is no other alternative for becoming and destruction to be established.

original: brjod du med pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: brjod du med pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that they are established as inexpressible,

analyzed: brjod du med pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gal te 'dres par gyur pa yin na de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: What is this so-called inexpressibility? If it is a mixture, that is not tenable.

analyzed: so sor ma grub pa dag la 'dres par gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a mixture does not exist for those that are not individually established.

analyzed: brjod du med pa ni nges par gzung du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhe na /

translated: then, because its own nature is the absence of determination, it follows that emergence and destruction are nonexistent, like the blueness and whiteness of a barren womanâ€™s son.

analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de dag gi rgyu dus kyang med do zhes bya bar grub po ;
translated: When emergence and destruction do not exist in this way, then it is established that their cause, time, also does not exist.

analyzed: ; gzhan yang 'di na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag rtog pa na dngos po zad pa'i chos can nam /

analyzed: ma zad pa'i chos can zhig la rtog grang na /
translated: If one imagines that a thing that is not exhausted exists,ğŸ”½both are untenable. In order to demonstrate this,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir / zad la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
translated: it is said:ğŸ”½There is no origination of that which is exhausted.

original: ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba @136a * //ğŸ”½med // zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: ma zad pa la'ang 'byung ba @136a * // med // zad la 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: Nor is there origination of that which is not exhausted.ğŸ”½There is no destruction of that which is exhausted.

original: ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med //ğŸ”½ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med // ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Nor is there destruction of that which is not exhausted.

original: de la zad pa ste dngos po zad pa'i chos can la ni 'gal ba'i chos yod pas 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la zad pa ste dngos po zad pa'i chos can la ni 'gal ba'i chos yod pas 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therein, origination is not tenable for that which is exhausted, i.e., for a thing that has the property of exhaustion, because an existent thing that is contradictory with it exists.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ma zad pa la yang 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ma zad pa la yang 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Nor is origination tenable for that which is not exhausted, because it does not have the characteristics of an existent thing,

original: bod bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: bod bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: zad pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te zad pa'i chos can ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: zad pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin te zad pa'i chos can ni med pa yin te /
translated: there is no destruction of that which is exhausted, because a thing that has the property of exhaustion is nonexistent.

original: de la rten med pa'i phyir 'jig pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la rten med pa'i phyir 'jig pa mi rigs so //
translated: Since there is no basis for it, destruction is not tenable.

original: de bzhin du ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma zad pa la'ang 'jig pa med de /
translated: Similarly, there is no destruction of that which is not exhausted.

original: ma zad pa'i chos can gyi dngos po ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa yin na /
analyzed: ma zad pa'i chos can gyi dngos po ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa yin na /
translated: A thing that is not an exhausted phenomenon is not in accordance with the characteristics of a thing.

original: yod pa ma yin pa de la 'jig pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa de la 'jig pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist have cessation?

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gang dag dngos po zad pa dang / ma zad pa'i chos can la mi srid pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gang dag dngos po zad pa dang / ma zad pa'i chos can la mi srid pa de dag ni /
translated: Arising and cessation are not possible for a thing that is an exhausted phenomenon or a nonexhausted phenomenon.

original: yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: They do not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag med do //
translated: Therefore, arising and cessation do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: The arising and cessation of things do exist.

original: de dag gi rten chos can yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rten chos can yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their basis, the thing, exists.

original: 'dir 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag ni dngos po la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag ni dngos po la brten pa yin la /
translated: Here, arising and cessation depend on a thing.

original: dngos po de yang re zhig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po de yang re zhig yod pa yin no //

original: de yod pas de la brten pa'i chos dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pas de la brten pa'i chos dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it exists, the phenomena that depend on it also exist.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te dngos po yod na ni //
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod na ni //

analyzed: dngos po la brten pa'i chos de gnyis yod par 'gyur na /

original: gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe //
translated: then at that timeğŸ”½Things would exist.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //

analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //

analyzed: yang ci'i phyir dngos po yod pa ma yin zhe na /

original: 'di ltar / 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid du gyur ba yin na /
translated: Arising and destruction are the characteristics of things.

original: de dag ni bkag pa yin no ;
analyzed: de dag ni bkag pa yin no ;
translated: They have been refuted.

original: ; gang gi tshe bkag pa de'i tshe dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med par dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ; gang gi tshe bkag pa de'i tshe dngos po'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med par dngos po'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: When they are refuted, then how could things that are not in accordance with the characteristics of things, that is, without the characteristics of arising and destruction, exist?

analyzed: dngos po med na ni 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dag kyang yod pa ma yin no // gzhan dag ni 'byung ba dang 'jig @136b pa dag yod pa yin te /

analyzed: dngos po'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni dngos po'i chos med de /
translated: But that which does not exist here has no property of an entity.

analyzed: dper na sbal pa'i ral pa bzhin no //

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa gnyis ni dngos po'i chos kyang yin no //

original: de'i phyir de dag yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag yod do zhe na /

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig la don dam par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod na ni /
translated: If emergence and destruction exist ultimately for something,

analyzed: de dngos po zhes bya bar brjod par rigs par 'gyur na /

original: de dag ni med de /
analyzed: de dag ni med de /
translated: But they do not exist.ğŸ”½Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / 'byung dang 'jig pa med na ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'byung dang 'jig pa med na ni //
translated: If emergence and destruction do not exist,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no ste /

analyzed: dngos po ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod na yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //

analyzed: de med na ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i don nyid yin no //
translated: If they do not exist, the reason is not established.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin te /
translated: emergence and destruction do not exist.

analyzed: rten med pas brten pa ma grub po zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no zhes phyed gang ma phyed 'og mar byas nas rnam par 'chad do // gzhan yang 'dir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag rtog pa na dngos po stong pa'am /
translated: The meaning is that since there is no basis, the based is not established.ğŸ”½Moreover, if you imagine that these emergences and destructions are of things that are empty or

translated: not empty,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //

analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro // stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /
translated: This is taught by:ğŸ”½Emergences and destructions

original: 'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: are not tenable in the empty.

analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i ri mo bzhin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that, like a sky-flower, they do not have a basis.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,ğŸ”½Emergences and destructions

original: mi stong la yang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi stong la yang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: are not tenable in the non-empty.

original: mi stong pa la yod pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi stong pa la yod pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that which is not empty has an essence that exists,

analyzed: rten med pas 'byung ba dang 'jig pa 'brad pa yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod na /

analyzed: de dag gcig nyid dam gzhan nyid du yod pa zhig na /

analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: it is said that neither is tenable.ğŸ”½It is not tenable that emergence and destruction

analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid ni mi 'thad do ;
translated: are the same.

original: ; snang ba dang mun pa ltar phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni gcig nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ; snang ba dang mun pa ltar phan tshun 'gal ba dag ni gcig nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that that which is mutually contradictory, like light and darkness, are the same.ğŸ”½It is not tenable that emergence and destruction

analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: are different.

original: gnyi ga phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga phan tshun mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not mutually confused.

original: 'byung ba dang bral ba la ni 'jig pa mi rigs la /ğŸ”½'jig pa @137a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang bral ba la ni 'jig pa mi rigs la / 'jig pa @137a * //
translated: Destruction is not tenable without emergence.ğŸ”½Without destruction,

original: dang bral ba la ni 'byung ba ma mthong ste /
analyzed: dang bral ba la ni 'byung ba ma mthong ste /

original: de ltar na gnyi ga phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because they are not mutually confused.ğŸ”½It is not tenable that emergence and destruction

analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: are different.

original: ci ste zhib mor brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: ci ste zhib mor brtags pa 'dis ci zhig bya //
translated: But if you carefully investigate this, what is there to do?

original: gang gi phyir skye bo ba glang rdzi dang bud med yan chad kyis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa mthong ba de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye bo ba glang rdzi dang bud med yan chad kyis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa mthong ba de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa yin te /
translated: Because all people, from cowherds to women, see emergence and destruction, therefore emergence and destruction exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu ni blta bar mi nus so snyam na /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu ni blta bar mi nus so snyam na /
translated: But it is not possible to see the son of a barren woman, which does not exist.

original: gal te de ltar /
analyzed: gal te de ltar /
translated: If you think in that way,

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
translated: â€œI see emergence and destruction,â€

original: 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: this is not definite.

original: gang dang gang 'jig rten pas mthong ba de dang de yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di ltar skye bo ba glang rdzi dang bud med yan chad kyis yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: gang dang gang 'jig rten pas mthong ba de dang de yod pa nyid ni ma yin no // 'di ltar skye bo ba glang rdzi dang bud med yan chad kyis yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Whatever is seen by the world does not exist.ğŸ”½In that case, even though they do not exist,

original: dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dang / sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa mthong zhing /
translated: all people, from cowherds to women, see a gandharva city, illusions, dreams, a firebrand wheel, water in a mirage, and so on.

original: dbang po la gnod par gyur pa las rab rib can gyi skra shad dang / sbrang ma dang sbrang bu mchu ring sa dag mthong ba yin te /ğŸ”½de bzhin du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang med bzhin du mi shes pa'i gti mug gi rab rib can gyi blo'i mig ldongs par byas pas mthong ba yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: dbang po la gnod par gyur pa las rab rib can gyi skra shad dang / sbrang ma dang sbrang bu mchu ring sa dag mthong ba yin te / de bzhin du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag kyang med bzhin du mi shes pa'i gti mug gi rab rib can gyi blo'i mig ldongs par byas pas mthong ba yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: The eyes of those whose eyes are impaired by cataracts see such things as floating hairs, flies, and double moons.

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //
translated: In the same way, the eyes of the ignorant, whose eyes are impaired by the cataracts of ignorance, see becoming and destruction, though they do not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said:ğŸ”½Becoming and destruction are seenğŸ”½Through the cataracts of ignorance.

original: ci ste 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo can 'di dag gti mug kho nas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di de ltar cis nges she na /
analyzed: ci ste 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo can 'di dag gti mug kho nas mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di de ltar cis nges she na /
translated: If you ask, â€œHow is it certain that becoming and destruction are seen through the cataracts of ignorance, but they do not exist inherently?â€

original: 'di ni de ltar rigs pas nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar rigs pas nges pa yin no //
translated: It is certain through reasoning.

original: 'dir rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning here?

original: 'dir gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: 'dir gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: Here, if things existed,

original: de nges par dngos po'am dngos po med pa las skye ba zhig yin /
analyzed: de nges par dngos po'am dngos po med pa las skye ba zhig yin /
translated: That must be either arisen from a thing or arisen from a nonthing.

original: de bzhin du gal te dngos po med pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te dngos po med pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: Similarly, if something called a nonthing exists,

original: de yang dngos po'am dngos po med pa las skye ba zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: de yang dngos po'am dngos po med pa las skye ba zhig yin grang na /
translated: then that must be either arisen from a thing or arisen from a nonthing.

original: gnyis char gnyi ga ltar yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /ğŸ”½dngos po dngos las mi skye ste //
analyzed: gnyis char gnyi ga ltar yang yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa / dngos po dngos las mi skye ste //
translated: But both are not so.ğŸ”½A thing does not arise from a thing.

original: dngos po dngos med las mi skye //ğŸ”½dngos med dngos med mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med las mi skye // dngos med dngos med mi skye ste //
translated: A thing does not arise from a nonthing.ğŸ”½A nonthing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a thing.

original: re zhig @137b dngos po ste yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ste yang dag par 'byung ba las skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig @137b dngos po ste yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ste yang dag par 'byung ba las skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: First, a thing, that is, a real entity, does not arise from a thing, that is, a real entity,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig pa med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba rnyed zin pa'i skye ba la yang skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis dus gcig pa med pa'i phyir dang / skye ba rnyed zin pa'i skye ba la yang skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cause and effect do not exist at the same time and because it is pointless for that which has already obtained arising to arise again.

original: dngos po ni dngos po med pa las kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po med pa las kyang mi skye'o //
translated: A thing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig cing rnam par 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig cing rnam par 'jig pa yin la /
translated: â€œNon-entityâ€ is the destruction and disintegration of an entity.

original: de yang dngos po dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: And that is incompatible with an entity.

original: dngos po dang 'gal ba de'i phyir de las dngos po ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po dang 'gal ba de'i phyir de las dngos po ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could an entity arise from that?

original: gal te 'gyur na ni mo gsham gyi bu mo las kyang bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na ni mo gsham gyi bu mo las kyang bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it could, then a son could be born from a barren woman.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ni dngos po med pa las kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ni dngos po med pa las kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, an entity does not arise from a non-entity.

original: da ni dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: da ni dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa las mi 'byung ste /
translated: Now, a non-entity also does not arise from a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po log pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po log pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: A non-entity has the nature of the cessation of an entity.

original: de'i phyir de la 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa ga la yod /
translated: Therefore, how could it have the ability to generate an effect?

original: gal te yod na ni mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did, then even nirvana would have the power to generate an effect.

original: gal te dngos po med pa las dngos po med pa 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa las dngos po med pa 'byung bar 'gyur na ni /
translated: If a non-entity arose from a non-entity,

original: de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu mo las kyang bu skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu mo las kyang bu skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: In that case, a son would be born from a barren woman.

original: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, a nonthing

original: dngos po med pa las kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa las kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: does not arise from a nonthing.

original: da ni dngos po med pa dngos po las kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: da ni dngos po med pa dngos po las kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: Now, a nonthing does not arise from a thing either.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po dang 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po dang 'gal ba yin na /
translated: A nonthing is the opposite of a thing.

original: de ji ltar dngos po las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos po las 'byung bar 'gyur /

original: gal te 'gyur na ni sgron ma las kyang mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na ni sgron ma las kyang mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it could, then darkness could arise from a lamp.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par dpyad na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gti mug nyid kyis mthong pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par dpyad na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gti mug nyid kyis mthong pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since arising and destruction do not exist in this way when analyzed, therefore it should be understood that â€œit is seen due to delusion.â€

original: rnam pa gcig tu na phyogs snga ma 'di gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na phyogs snga ma 'di gzhan yin no //
translated: Or, this former position is different.

original: 'di ltar 'dir gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod na ni /
translated: Thus, if arising and destruction exist here,

original: de dag dngos po la brten pa'am /
analyzed: de dag dngos po la brten pa'am /
translated: they would depend on a thing or

original: dngos po med pa la brten par 'gyur ba zhig na /ğŸ”½dngos po dang dngos po med pa de gnyis ni rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la brten par 'gyur ba zhig na / dngos po dang dngos po med pa de gnyis ni rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: But since things and nonthings are not at all existent when they are

original: thams cad du yod pa ma yin te de'i phyir rten med pas @138a * //
analyzed: thams cad du yod pa ma yin te de'i phyir rten med pas @138a * //
translated: analyzed, therefore, since they have no basis,

analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dgag la yod / de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ma yin //
translated: arising and destruction are refuted.ğŸ”½Therefore, it should be understood that:ğŸ”½Arising and destruction are not seen

original: zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: due to confusion.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how things and nonthings do not exist, it says:

original: dngos po dngos las mi skye ste //ğŸ”½dngos po dngos med las mi skye //ğŸ”½dngos med dngos med mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po dngos las mi skye ste // dngos po dngos med las mi skye // dngos med dngos med mi skye ste //
translated: A thing does not arise from a thing.ğŸ”½A thing does not arise from a nonthing.ğŸ”½A nonthing does not arise from a nonthing.

analyzed: dngos med dngos las mi skye'o // zhes gsungs te /
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a thing.

original: 'di'i don ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of this is the same as before.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: Moreover, if something called a â€œthingâ€ existed,

original: de skye zhing zang pa dang ldan pas 'byung ba dang 'jig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de skye zhing zang pa dang ldan pas 'byung ba dang 'jig par 'gyur na /
translated: Since it arises and perishes, it would originate and be destroyed.

original: dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But no entity exists at all,

original: bong bu'i rva ltar rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bong bu'i rva ltar rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not intrinsically produced, like the horn of an ass.

original: ma skyes pa nyid ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid ma grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that non-production is not established,

original: ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not not established.ğŸ”½Thus:

original: 'di ltar / dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
translated: An entity does not arise from itself,

original: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
translated: nor does it arise from another.

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba na //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba na //
translated: Since it does not arise from itself and another,

original: yod min ji ltar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod min ji ltar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: how could it arise?

original: 'di ni rab tu byed pa dang por rnam par bshad zin pa'i phyir yang mi bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu byed pa dang por rnam par bshad zin pa'i phyir yang mi bshad do //
translated: Since this has already been explained in the first chapter, it will not be explained again.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa dag gis skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa dag gis skye ba yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since arising does not exist in the ways that have been explained, how could it arise?

original: ji ltar yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yang skye bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is that it will not arise in any way at all.

original: dngos po skye ba rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po skye ba rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni de ltar gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is definitely necessary to accept that â€œThings that arise do not exist in any way.â€

original: de lta ma yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni /
translated: If that is not so,

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
translated: then having accepted that things exist,ğŸ”½one will be forced to accept

original: rtag dang chad par lta bar ni //ğŸ”½thal bar 'gyur te /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rtag dang chad par lta bar ni // thal bar 'gyur te / gang gi phyir /
translated: the views of eternalism and nihilism.ğŸ”½Why is that?

original: dngos po de ni /
analyzed: dngos po de ni /
translated: Because that thing

original: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: would be permanent or impermanent.

original: gang zhig dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bshad pa las 'das nas dngos por lta ba khas len pa de ni gdon mi za bar gsung rab dang shin tu 'gal ba rtag pa dang chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bshad pa las 'das nas dngos por lta ba khas len pa de ni gdon mi za bar gsung rab dang shin tu 'gal ba rtag pa dang chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one goes beyond the explanation of the existence of things, as it has been explained, and accepts the view that things exist, then one will definitely be forced to accept the views of eternalism and nihilism, which are in complete contradiction to the scriptures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po de brtags pa na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po de brtags pa na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig tu 'gyur grang /
translated: Because if one analyzes that thing, it will be either permanent or impermanent.

original: gal te rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe nges par rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe nges par rtag par smra bar 'gyur la /
translated: If it is permanent, then one will definitely be forced to accept eternalism.

original: 'on te mi rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe nges bar chad par smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe nges bar chad par smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is impermanent, then it would definitely be said to be annihilated.

original: 'dir @138b smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir @138b smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
translated: Even though one accepts that things exist,

original: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: there is no annihilation and no permanence.ğŸ”½Why is that?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /ğŸ”½gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //
translated: The continuum of the arising and ceasing of the effect and cause is existence.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gi srid pa ste 'khor ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gi srid pa ste 'khor ba yin no //
translated: That which is the continuum of the arising and ceasing of the effect and cause is our existence, that is, samsara.

original: de la gal te rgyu 'gags shing de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bu mi skye na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu 'gags shing de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bu mi skye na ni /
translated: If the cause ceases and the effect that is caused by it does not arise,

original: de'i tshe chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe chad par 'gyur la /
translated: then at that time there would be annihilation.

original: gal te rgyu mi 'gag cing rang gi ngo bos gnas na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu mi 'gag cing rang gi ngo bos gnas na ni /
translated: But if the cause does not cease and it endures by its own nature,
