analyzed: de'i tshe rtag par thal bar yang 'gyur na de ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: then at that time it would follow that it is permanent. But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir dngos po khas blangs su zin kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po khas blangs su zin kyang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though you accept that things exist, the error of nihilism and eternalism does not follow.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyun rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par ma chad par rim par 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i rgyun rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par ma chad par rim par 'byung ba gang yin pa de nyid 'khor ba yin te /
translated: The continuum of the arising and ceasing of compounded phenomena, which occurs in a series without the interruption of cause and effect, is cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag la nyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag la nyes pa 'di yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, we do not commit this error.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa yin gyur na //
translated: If the continuum of the arising and ceasing of cause and effect were cyclic existence,

original: de lta na yang //
analyzed: de lta na yang //
translated: then even though that is so,

original: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
translated: because that which is ceasing does not arise,

original: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the error of nihilism would follow for you.

original: ma yin nam /ğŸ”½gang rgyu'i skad cig ma 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rgyur gyur nas 'gag pa /
analyzed: ma yin nam / gang rgyu'i skad cig ma 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la rgyur gyur nas 'gag pa /
translated: Isnâ€™t that so?ğŸ”½The moment of the cause that has become the cause of the arising of the effect and then ceases,

original: rgyu'i skad cig ma 'jig pa dang ldan pa de yang mi skye ba'i phyir chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i skad cig ma 'jig pa dang ldan pa de yang mi skye ba'i phyir chad par lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that moment of the cause that possesses disintegration does not arise again. Therefore, the error of nihilism would follow.

original: khyod la skyon 'dir ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyod la skyon 'dir ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how is it that you do not commit this error?

original: dngos po khas len pa la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po khas len pa la nyes pa 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: This error is committed by those who accept that things exist.

original: ngas ni dngos po khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: ngas ni dngos po khas ma blangs te /
translated: But I do not accept that things exist,

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are unarisen.ğŸ”½And also:

original: gang du / gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang du / gang la brten te gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on what

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min //
translated: is not that which is dependent on it,

original: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: nor is it different from it.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

analyzed: zhes bshad pa der yang kho bos tshul 'dis dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par bstan pa yin te /
translated: In this context, I have demonstrated that things lack intrinsic existence.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: dngos po rang gi ngo bo yod na ni sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi ngo bo yod na ni sa bon dang myu gu dag gzhan nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: if the essence of things existed, how could seeds and sprouts not be different?

original: de'i phyir thal ba 'di kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ba 'di kho bo cag la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this reductio does not undermine our position.

analyzed: de ltar re zhig dngos po yod par khas len na rgyu yang skye ba med pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ba brjod nas /

original: da ni @139a * //
analyzed: da ni @139a * //
translated: now,

original: rtag pa'i nyes par thal bar brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa'i nyes par thal bar brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to state the consequence of the error of eternalism,

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: CandrakÄ«rti says, If things exist intrinsically,

original: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it would not be tenable for them to become nonexistent.

original: gal te rgyu rang bzhin gyis yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rang bzhin gyis yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If the cause existed essentially,

original: de phyis yod pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yod pa ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not become nonexistent later,

original: rang bzhin la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an essence cannot be altered.

original: de'i phyir rtag par lta bar thal ba son 'dug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par lta bar thal ba son 'dug go //
translated: Therefore, the consequence of the view of eternalism would follow.ğŸ”½Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
translated: at the time of nirvana, there would be annihilation,

original: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
translated: because the continuum of existence would be completely extinguished.

original: gal te yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun 'jug pas rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba spong bar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun 'jug pas rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba spong bar byed mod kyi /
translated: If one were to argue that the consequence of the view of eternalism and annihilationism is avoided because the continuum of the arising and ceasing of cause and effect continues,

analyzed: de lta na yang gang du rgyun de yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba mya ngan las 'das pa der ni nges par chad par lta bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if that were so, then when that continuum does not arise in nirvana, it would definitely be viewed as annihilated.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni chad par lta ba spang bar bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni chad par lta ba spang bar bya ba gsungs so //
translated: But the BhagavÃ¥n taught that the view of annihilation should be rejected.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni chad par lta ba yin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni chad par lta ba yin par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not the view of annihilation!

original: khyod la gzhan yang ci'i phyir yin par 'gyur te /ğŸ”½mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su dngos po rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa ltar /
analyzed: khyod la gzhan yang ci'i phyir yin par 'gyur te / mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus su dngos po rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa ltar /
translated: What else could it be?ğŸ”½Because it is the view of the annihilation of things at the time of nirvana,

analyzed: dngos po rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o // gang yang / 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi /
translated: just as it is the view of the annihilation of things in the past.ğŸ”½Also, the following is unacceptable:ğŸ”½The continuum of the arising and ceasing of effects

original: rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro //ğŸ”½zhes smras pa de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rgyun de srid pa yin phyir ro // zhes smras pa de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: is the process of becoming.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is it unacceptable?

original: 'dir srid pa tha ma ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
analyzed: 'dir srid pa tha ma ni ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la /
translated: Here, the final stage of cyclic existence is characterized by cessation.

original: dang po ni 'gro ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: dang po ni 'gro ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The first is the characteristic of the link of becoming.

original: de la srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ni rgyu nyid du gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de la srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa ni rgyu nyid du gnas pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, the final moment of existence that is in the process of cessation exists as the cause.

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can srid pa dang po ni 'bras bu'i ngo bor gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid can srid pa dang po ni 'bras bu'i ngo bor gnas pa yin te /
translated: The first moment of existence that has the characteristic of birth exists as the effect.

original: srid pa de gnyis la 'khor ba zhes ming du btags pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa de gnyis la 'khor ba zhes ming du btags pa yin no //
translated: These two moments of existence are designated as â€œsamsara.â€

original: 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ba ste /
translated: Here, this should be investigated:

original: gang las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun gyis 'khor bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun gyis 'khor bar 'gyur ba /
translated: From what cause and effect continuum does samsara arise?

analyzed: srid pa dang po 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de ci srid pa tha ma 'gags pa'am /
translated: The first moment of existence that exists as the nature of the effect, does it arise when the final moment of existence has ceased,

original: 'on te ma 'gags pa'am de ste 'gag bzhin pa na skye grang /
analyzed: 'on te ma 'gags pa'am de ste 'gag bzhin pa na skye grang /
translated: or when it has not ceased, or when it is in the process of ceasing?ğŸ”½In order to demonstrate that when this is investigated, it does not exist in any way,

original: rnam par dpyad na rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: tha ma 'gags par gyur pa na //

original: srid pa dang po rigs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang po rigs mi 'gyur //
translated: The first moment of existence is not tenable.

original: tha ma 'gags @139b par ma gyur tshe //
analyzed: tha ma 'gags @139b par ma gyur tshe //
translated: If the final existence did not cease,

original: srid pa dang po rigs mi 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa dang po rigs mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: The first existence would not be tenable.

original: de la gal te srid pa tha ma 'gags pa ni srid pa dang po skye'o zhes rtog na ni /

original: sa bon tshig pa las kyang myu gu skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sa bon tshig pa las kyang myu gu skye bar 'gyur na /

original: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir tha ma 'gags pa na srid pa dang po mi rigs so /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha ma 'gags pa na srid pa dang po mi rigs so /
translated: Therefore, when the final existence ceases, the first existence is not tenable.

analyzed: da ni srid pa tha ma ma 'gags pa na yang srid pa dang po rigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Now, even when the final existence does not cease, the first existence is not tenable.

original: gal te 'gyur na ni rgyu med pa dang / sems can gcig la ngo bo gnyis yod pa dang / sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung ba dang / snga ma rtag pa nyid dang / sa bon ma zhig pa la myu gu skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na ni rgyu med pa dang / sems can gcig la ngo bo gnyis yod pa dang / sngon med pa'i sems can 'byung ba dang / snga ma rtag pa nyid dang / sa bon ma zhig pa la myu gu skye bar 'gyur na /

original: de dag ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir / tha ma 'gags par ma gyur tshe //
analyzed: de'i phyir / tha ma 'gags par ma gyur tshe //

original: srid pa dang po rigs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa dang po rigs mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: da ni srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na yang ji ltar srid pa dang po mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin na //

original: dang po skye bar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: dang po skye bar 'gyur na ni //

analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //

original: srid pa gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: srid pa gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur na /

analyzed: gcig la cig car gnyis yod pa yang ma yin pas 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: it is illogical that two existences would exist simultaneously in one person.ğŸ”½Therefore, as explained,

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par dpyad pa'i tshul gyis /

original: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur pa //
analyzed: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur pa //

analyzed: de la skye ba'ang 'byung 'gyur ram //

original: 'ang gi sgra ni bsdu ba'i don du ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi bzhin pa ni skye bar ma mthong ngo // de'i phyir / de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //

analyzed: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //

analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po yod par khas len na rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal ba de nyid bzlog par dka' ba yin no //

analyzed: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur // gang gi tshe de ltar rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi dngos po @143a * //

original: dag med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dag med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality do not exist in this way,ğŸ”½thenğŸ”½Apart from intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality,

analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //

original: de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //

analyzed: brten nas de las 'gyur la rag / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po dag las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod du med pa zhig phung po dag la brten nas 'dogs so snyam du sems na ni /

analyzed: de la gal te phung po rnams la ma brten par te ma bzung bar sngar de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod cing phung po la brten nas gyur pa de'i tshe rigs te /

analyzed: 'di ltar sngar nor las tha dad par grub pa'i lha sbyin ni nor len par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du gal te phung po la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni /

translated: then when it is analyzed in every way,ğŸ”½the TathÄgata would not be dependent on the aggregates.

analyzed: gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa de nye bar len pa'i snga rol du med pas cung zad kyang mi len pa de'i tshe sus kyang nye bar ma blangs pas de'i nye bar len pa yang nye bar len pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan

analyzed: pa'i phyir / nye bar blangs pa ma yin par // nye bar len par cis mi 'gyur //
translated: Why would it not be the appropriatorğŸ”½without being appropriated?ğŸ”½

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //

translated: He is the incomparable refuge of all beings.ğŸ”½He possesses the immaculate maá¹‡á¸ala of the ten powers, the four types of fearlessness, and the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha.

analyzed: stong pas de bzhin gshegs stong pa /

analyzed: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur //

original: brjod par bya ste /

original: ci ste gal te bdag gi yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid med pa de'i tshe gang las de rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid dag med par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: ci ste gal te bdag gi yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid med pa de'i tshe gang las de rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid dag med par 'gyur ba /
translated: But if the existence and nonexistence of the self do not exist, then on the basis of what would the existence and nonexistence of those be established?

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams las ci zhig 'byung snyam na /
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams las ci zhig 'byung snyam na /
translated: Here, what arises from the afflictions?ğŸ”½It is said:

original: brjod pa / nyon mongs 'di dag gang gi yin //
analyzed: brjod pa / nyon mongs 'di dag gang gi yin //
translated: These afflictions belong to someone.

original: de yang 'grub pa yod pa yin //
analyzed: de yang 'grub pa yod pa yin //
translated: And that person exists.

original: 'ga' med pa ni gang gi yang //
analyzed: 'ga' med pa ni gang gi yang //
translated: But if there is no one,

original: nyon mongs pa dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag yod ma yin //
translated: The afflictions do not exist.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtsig ngos kyi ri mo dang 'bras bu smin pa nyid bzhin du bskyed bar bya ba brten pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa 'di dag rtsig ngos kyi ri mo dang 'bras bu smin pa nyid bzhin du bskyed bar bya ba brten pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Here, these afflictions are like a painting on a wall or like the ripening of fruit. They are dependent on a basis that is produced.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gang zhig gi yin par 'gyur gyi rten 'ga' zhig med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gang zhig gi yin par 'gyur gyi rten 'ga' zhig med par ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they belong to someone, but not without a basis.

original: rten de yang brtags pa na bdag gam sems shig yin pa zhig na /
analyzed: rten de yang brtags pa na bdag gam sems shig yin pa zhig na /
translated: And that basis is either the self or the mind.

original: de dag gi rten de ni sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no//
analyzed: de dag gi rten de ni sngar bkag zin pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin no//
translated: But since that basis has already been refuted earlier, it does not exist.

original: @148b rten de 'ga' yang med par ni gang gi nyon mongs pa yin par 'gyur /ğŸ”½de med pa nyid kyi phyir gang gi phyir yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: @148b rten de 'ga' yang med par ni gang gi nyon mongs pa yin par 'gyur / de med pa nyid kyi phyir gang gi phyir yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: But if there is no basis at all, whose are the afflictions?ğŸ”½Since there is no basis, they are not anyoneâ€™s.ğŸ”½It is said:

original: 'ga' med par ni gang gi yang //
analyzed: 'ga' med par ni gang gi yang //
translated: There is no basis at all

original: nyon mongs pa dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag yod ma yin //
translated: For the existence of the afflictions.

original: 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten sngar grub pa ni 'ga' yang khas mi len la ;
analyzed: 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rten sngar grub pa ni 'ga' yang khas mi len la ;
translated: Here, we do not accept that the basis of the afflictions is established in any way.

original: gang zhig rten nyid du rnam par gzhag pa bdag ces bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rten nyid du rnam par gzhag pa bdag ces bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And there is no so-called self that is posited as the basis.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i aa mra'i shing bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i aa mra'i shing bzhin no //
translated: Because it has no cause, it is like a sky-flower.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la brten nas nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The afflictions arise in dependence on an afflicted mind.

original: sems de yang nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig skye'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sems de yang nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig skye'o zhes zer ro //
translated: And that mind arises simultaneously with the afflictions.

original: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa /ğŸ”½rang lus lta zhing nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: 'di yang mi rigs so zhes bshad pa / rang lus lta zhing nyon mongs rnams //
translated: This is also unreasonable. It is said:ğŸ”½The afflictions do not exist in five ways

original: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rnam lngar med //
translated: In the afflicted mind that views its own body.

original: rang lus lta zhig nyon mongs can //
analyzed: rang lus lta zhig nyon mongs can //
translated: The body is not the defilements,

original: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la rnam lngar med //
translated: nor is it in the defilements in any of the five ways.

original: rang lus zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs so //ğŸ”½rang gi lus la lta ba ni rang lus lta ste /
analyzed: rang lus zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshogs so // rang gi lus la lta ba ni rang lus lta ste /
translated: The body is the collection of aggregates, which are characterized by form, etc.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par 'dzin par zhugs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par 'dzin par zhugs so //
translated: The view of the body is the view of the self, which is the entry into the grasping of the self and what belongs to the self.

original: ji ltar 'di /ğŸ”½phung min phung po las gzhan min //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di / phung min phung po las gzhan min //
translated: How is this so?

original: de la phung med der de med //
analyzed: de la phung med der de med //
translated: The aggregates are not the self, nor is the self something different from the aggregates,ğŸ”½nor are the aggregates in the self, nor is the self in the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung ldan min //
translated: nor do the aggregates possess the self.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis rnam pa lngar dpyad pa na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis rnam pa lngar dpyad pa na //
translated: Thus, when analyzed in five ways,

original: rang gi lus la yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam pa lngar dpyad pa na nyon mongs pa can la yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½de la nyon mongs par byed pas ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi lus la yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam pa lngar dpyad pa na nyon mongs pa can la yod pa ma yin no // de la nyon mongs par byed pas ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: the defilements are not in the one who is defiled in any of the five ways.ğŸ”½Here, the defilements are so called because they defile.

original: nyon mongs par bya bas na nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs par bya bas na nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: The one who is defiled is so called because he is defiled.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de nyid nyon mongs pa rnams yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de nyid nyon mongs pa rnams yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that that which is afflicted is itself the afflictions.

original: sreg pa po dang bsreg par bya ba dag kyang gcig nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sreg pa po dang bsreg par bya ba dag kyang gcig nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For then it would follow that the one who burns and that which is burned would be the same.

original: nyon mongs pa can yang gzhan la nyon mongs rnams kyang gzhan yin no zhes bya bar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yang gzhan la nyon mongs rnams kyang gzhan yin no zhes bya bar yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that that which is afflicted is one thing and the afflictions are another,

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu las ma byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu las ma byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because then the afflictions would not arise from the cause of that which is afflicted, since they would not depend on another.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid med pa de nyid kyi phyir //ğŸ”½rten dang brten pa dang de dang ldan pa'i phyogs rnams med pas nyon mongs pa rnams la @149a * //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid med pa de nyid kyi phyir // rten dang brten pa dang de dang ldan pa'i phyogs rnams med pas nyon mongs pa rnams la @149a * //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of sameness and difference,ğŸ”½the positions of the basis, the dependent, and their connection do not exist.

original: nyon mongs pa can med la /ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa can la nyon mongs pa rnams med cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can med la / nyon mongs pa can la nyon mongs pa rnams med cing /
translated: Therefore, the afflictions do not exist in that which is afflicted.ğŸ”½The afflictions do not exist in that which is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: That which is afflicted is not connected with the afflictions.

original: de ltar na rnam pa lngas dpyad pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa lngas dpyad pa na /
translated: Thus, when analyzed in five ways,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can la yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: the afflictions do not exist in the afflicted.

original: ; ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu can nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ; ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi rgyu can nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the afflictions do not exist as the cause of the afflicted,

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can gyi nyon mongs pa can yang rnam pa lngas dpyad pa na nyon mongs pa rnams la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can gyi nyon mongs pa can yang rnam pa lngas dpyad pa na nyon mongs pa rnams la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, when analyzed in five ways, the afflicted do not exist in the afflictions.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa rnams nyid nyon mongs pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa rnams nyid nyon mongs pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the afflictions themselves are not the afflicted,

original: byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa rnams kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las dag gcig pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa rnams kyang gzhan la /
translated: because it follows that the agent and the object would be the same.

original: nyon mongs pa can gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are the afflictions other than the afflicted,

original: ltos pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa can la nyon mongs pa rnams med la /
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa can la nyon mongs pa rnams med la /
translated: because it follows that they would be unrelated.ğŸ”½The afflictions do not exist in the afflicted,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can med cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa can med cing /
translated: and the afflicted do not exist in the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams nyon mongs pa can dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Afflictions do not exist in those who are afflicted.

original: de ltar na rang gi lus la lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi lus la lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa can yang nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam pa lngar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, just as with oneâ€™s own body, the afflicted do not exist in the afflictions in any of the five ways.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa can dag phan tshun ltos nas grub pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, afflictions and those who are afflicted do not exist in mutual dependence.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te yang khyod kyis nyon mongs pa rnams bkag mod kyi //
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis nyon mongs pa rnams bkag mod kyi //
translated: â€œEven though you have refuted the afflictions,

original: de lta na yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phyin ci log dag ni re zhig yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phyin ci log dag ni re zhig yod pa yin no //
translated: still the causes of the afflictionsâ€”attractive, unattractive, and erroneous conceptionsâ€”exist.

original: de yod pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pas nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they exist, the afflictions also exist.â€

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We respond:

original: gal te sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phyin ci log dag nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phyin ci log dag nyid yod na /
translated: If attractive, unattractive, and erroneous conceptions existed,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then the afflictions would exist.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: But since they do not exist,ğŸ”½the afflictions do not exist.

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / de dag kyang rang bzhin las ni yod min na ste /
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / de dag kyang rang bzhin las ni yod min na ste /
translated: The afflictions do not exist due to intrinsic reality,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dgag pa chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dgag pa chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are dependently arisen and because their cessation would be impossible.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When they do not exist due to intrinsic reality,

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin //
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log / brten nas nyon mongs gang dag yin //
translated: then what afflictions could be based on the attractive, the unattractive, and error?

original: de'i rgyu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phyin @149b ci log rnams med pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang phyin @149b ci log rnams med pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa nyid do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the afflictions is the attractive, the unattractive, and error. Since they do not exist, the afflictions do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /ğŸ”½nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa nyid de //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa nyid de //
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: de dag gi dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflictions do exist because their objects exist.

original: 'dir yang gang med pa de la ni dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang gang med pa de la ni dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here also, if something does not exist, it does not have an object,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: just like the son of a barren woman.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos zhes bya ba dmigs pa rnam pa drug ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg dang chos zhes bya ba dmigs pa rnam pa drug ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The six kinds of objects of perception, form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects, exist.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa yod pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa nyid du brjod par bya ste khyed cag gis /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa yod pas nyon mongs pa rnams yod pa nyid du brjod par bya ste khyed cag gis /
translated: Therefore, since the objects of perception exist, the afflictions should be said to exist.

original: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ro dang reg pa dang // dri dang chos dag rnam drug ni //
translated: You say that the six kinds of objects of perception, form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects,

original: bzhi ste 'dod chags zhe sdang dang // gti mug gis ni yin par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni yod do //
analyzed: bzhi ste 'dod chags zhe sdang dang // gti mug gis ni yin par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni yod do //
translated: are the four, desire, hatred, ignorance, and the view of self, which exist.

original: de la de las skye ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dir gnas pas bzhi ste dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de las skye ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'dir gnas pas bzhi ste dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since desire, etc., are based on them, they are the four objects of perception.

original: dmigs pa de yang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos zhes bya ba dang drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa de yang gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang chos zhes bya ba dang drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Those objects of perception are sixfold: form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects.

original: yongs su gcod par byed pa dbang po drug phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pa dbang po drug phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are six because the six faculties that determine them are different from each other.

original: de la 'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: de la 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: In this regard, this is here.

original: pha gi ni pha gi na'o zhes nges par brtag tu rung ba'i phyir dang // gzugs su rung bas na gzugs so //
analyzed: pha gi ni pha gi na'o zhes nges par brtag tu rung ba'i phyir dang // gzugs su rung bas na gzugs so //
translated: It is form because it is suitable to be form.

original: 'dis don sgrogs shing ston par byed pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: 'dis don sgrogs shing ston par byed pas na sgra'o //
translated: It is sound because it causes the meaning to be proclaimed and revealed.

original: brngub cing bsnam par bya bas ni dri dag ste /ğŸ”½gang du phyin pa de las gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brngub cing bsnam par bya bas ni dri dag ste / gang du phyin pa de las gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is odor because it is inhaled and smelled.

original: bro zhing ro myang bar bya bas na ro'o //
analyzed: bro zhing ro myang bar bya bas na ro'o //
translated: It is taste because it is tasted and savored.

original: reg par bya bas na reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg par bya bas na reg pa'o //
translated: It is tangible because it is tangible.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is a phenomenon because it holds its own characteristics.

original: chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa 'dzin pas na chos so //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa 'dzin pas na chos so //
translated: Or it is a phenomenon because it holds the supreme phenomenon, nirvana.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag gzhi yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag gzhi yin no //
translated: These six are the bases.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi'o //
translated: They are the bases of attachment, hostility, and confusion.

original: de la 'gal bas na 'dod chags te /
analyzed: de la 'gal bas na 'dod chags te /
translated: Attachment is so called because it is contrary to virtue.

original: chags pa dang lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is attachment because it is attachment and excessive attachment.

original: yang na 'dis sems dga' bar byed pas na 'dod chags so //
analyzed: yang na 'dis sems dga' bar byed pas na 'dod chags so //
translated: Or it is attachment because it delights the mind.

original: sun 'byin pas na zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: sun 'byin pas na zhe sdang ste /
translated: Hostility is so called because it is contrary to virtue.

original: kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: It is the state of being completely hostile.

original: yang na 'dis sems sun 'byin par byed pas na zhe sdang ngo //ğŸ”½gti mug pas na gti mug ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis sems sun 'byin par byed pas na zhe sdang ngo // gti mug pas na gti mug ste /
translated: Or, it is hatred because it causes the mind to be hostile.

original: kun nas gti mug pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas gti mug pa'o //
translated: It is delusion because it causes the mind to be deluded.

original: yang na 'dis sems gti mug tu byed pas ni gti mug go //
analyzed: yang na 'dis sems gti mug tu byed pas ni gti mug go //
translated: Or, it is delusion because it causes the mind to be deluded.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa @150a * //ğŸ”½rnam pa drug ni nyon mongs pa 'di dag gi gzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa @150a * // rnam pa drug ni nyon mongs pa 'di dag gi gzhi ste /
translated: Therefore, form, etc.

original: dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin no //
translated: are the bases of these afflictions, because they are the objects.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa dag la sdug pa'i rnam par sgro btags pas ni 'dod chags skye'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa dag la sdug pa'i rnam par sgro btags pas ni 'dod chags skye'o //
translated: Among them, desire arises from the superimposition of the aspect of beauty on form, etc.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam par sgro btags pas ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam par sgro btags pas ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Hatred arises from the superimposition of the aspect of ugliness.

original: rtag pa dang bdag la log par sgro btags pas ni gti mug skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag la log par sgro btags pas ni gti mug skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Delusion arises from the superimposition of permanence and self.

original: rnam pa drug po 'di dag gzhir btags pa bden mod kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po 'di dag gzhir btags pa bden mod kyi //
translated: Although these six aspects are indeed designated as the bases,

original: 'on kyang rab rib can dag gis yod pa ma yin pa'i skra shad la sogs pa ltar //
analyzed: 'on kyang rab rib can dag gis yod pa ma yin pa'i skra shad la sogs pa ltar //

analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma med pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis med par bstan nas /

analyzed: da ni phyin ci log med par bstan pa'i sgo nas gti mug kyang med par bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: stong la mi rtag yod min pas //

analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log ma yin //

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, error is said to be fourfold.

analyzed: 'dir phyin ci log ni bzhir brjod do //

analyzed: 'di lta ste phung po lnga po skad cig re re la 'jig cing mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log yin no //
translated: Whatever is the apprehension that what is impermanent in every moment and disintegrating is permanent is error.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: mi rtag pa la nges par gnod //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la nges par gnod //

original: gang la gnod yod de bde min //
analyzed: gang la gnod yod de bde min //

analyzed: de phyir gang zhig mi rtag pa //

analyzed: de ni thams cad sdug bsngal 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /

analyzed: bde ba'o snyam du log par 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log gzhan yin no //

original: de bzhin du /ğŸ”½khu khrag phrad pa'i sa bon can //
analyzed: de bzhin du / khu khrag phrad pa'i sa bon can //
translated: In the same way,ğŸ”½The seed of the union of semen and blood

original: bshad dang gci bas bskyed gyur zhing //
analyzed: bshad dang gci bas bskyed gyur zhing //
translated: is generated from feces and urine.

original: mi gtsang rang bzhin shes bzhin du //
analyzed: mi gtsang rang bzhin shes bzhin du //
translated: Knowing the nature of the body to be impure,

original: 'dod pa gang gis de la chags //
analyzed: 'dod pa gang gis de la chags //
translated: how can one be attached to it?

original: zhes bya ba de ltar rtag tu lus 'di bdag nyid thams cad du mi gtsang ba yin bzhin du rmongs pas de la gtsang ba nyid du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar rtag tu lus 'di bdag nyid thams cad du mi gtsang ba yin bzhin du rmongs pas de la gtsang ba nyid du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni phyin ci log yin no //
translated: Thus, this body is always impure in every way. The error is the grasping of it as pure due to delusion.

original: de bzhin du phung po lnga po bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa mi rtag pa'i phyir dang // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po lnga po bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa mi rtag pa'i phyir dang // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, the five aggregates are not of the nature of a self because they are impermanent and because they are subject to arising and cessation.

original: bdag med cing bdag gi rang bzhin gyis stong bzhin du /
analyzed: bdag med cing bdag gi rang bzhin gyis stong bzhin du /
translated: They are selfless and empty of the nature of a self.

original: de la rtag tu 'dzin pa de ni bdag med pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: de la rtag tu 'dzin pa de ni bdag med pa la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyin ci log yin no //
translated: The error is the adherence to a self in the selfless aggregates.

original: de ltar na phyin ci log bzhi po de dag ni gti mug gi rgyur gyur pa yin @151b no ;
analyzed: de ltar na phyin ci log bzhi po de dag ni gti mug gi rgyur gyur pa yin @151b no ;
translated: Thus, these four errors are the cause of delusion.

original: ; da ni 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: ; da ni 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Now, here we must investigate this:

original: gal te phung po rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa dag la rtag par 'dzin pa log pa ste /
analyzed: gal te phung po rtag pa nyid kyis stong pa dag la rtag par 'dzin pa log pa ste /
translated: If you posit that the apprehension of the aggregates as permanent is erroneous,

original: phyin ci log yin no zhes de ltar rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: phyin ci log yin no zhes de ltar rnam par 'jog na /
translated: because the aggregates are empty of permanence,

original: phung po rang bzhin gyis stong pa la mi rtag pa yang med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phung po rang bzhin gyis stong pa la mi rtag pa yang med pa ma yin nam /
translated: then since the aggregates are empty of intrinsic reality, are they not also empty of impermanence?

original: de'i phyir / stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / stong la mi rtag yod min pas //
translated: Therefore, since impermanence does not exist for the empty,

original: 'dzin pa ji ltar log pa yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ji ltar log pa yin //

original: 'di ltar phyin ci ma log pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la ltos nas rtag pa phyin ci log yin no zhes bya bar gzhag pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyin ci ma log pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la ltos nas rtag pa phyin ci log yin no zhes bya bar gzhag pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if you posit that permanence is erroneous in relation to impermanence that is not erroneous,

original: gang gi tshe stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid med pas de dang 'gal ba'i rtag pa nyid phyin ci log tu ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid med pas de dang 'gal ba'i rtag pa nyid phyin ci log tu ga la 'gyur /
translated: then since impermanence does not exist for the empty, how could permanence, which is incompatible with it, be erroneous, since impermanence does not exist?

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log med do //
translated: Therefore error does not exist.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid med pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal pa yang med cing mi gtsang ba yang med la bdag med pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin dang bral zhing rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i stong pa la mi rtag pa nyid med pa de bzhin du sdug bsngal pa yang med cing mi gtsang ba yang med la bdag med pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as impermanence does not exist in emptiness, which is devoid of intrinsic reality and not intrinsically produced, in the same way, suffering does not exist, impurity does not exist, and selflessness does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis stong pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa med pa de'i tshe de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bdag kyang phyin ci log tu lta ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin gyis stong pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa med pa de'i tshe de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang bdag kyang phyin ci log tu lta ga la 'gyur //
translated: When suffering and so on do not exist because of being empty of intrinsic reality, then how could their opposites, permanence, happiness, purity, and self, be seen as erroneous?

original: de'i phyir phyin ci log rang bzhin gyis med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci log rang bzhin gyis med do //
translated: Therefore, error does not exist intrinsically.

original: de med pa'i phyir na ma rig pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na ma rig pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Since that does not exist, how could ignorance exist?

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no cause.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Blessed One said:

original: ma rig pa dang ma rig rkyen byung gang //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ma rig rkyen byung gang //
translated: That which arises due to ignorance and conditions

original: nam yod yod par 'gyur ba ma yin te //
analyzed: nam yod yod par 'gyur ba ma yin te //
translated: Does not exist when it exists.

original: ma rig pa de 'jig rten yod min pa //
analyzed: ma rig pa de 'jig rten yod min pa //

analyzed: bsal bar bya ba dang / gzhag par bya ba dang / dbye bar bya ba'i phyir chos mi ston to //

translated: Blessed One, it is because that man has generated the idea of a woman where there is no woman, and has imagined something that is not real.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,ğŸ”½â€œSubhÅ«ti, it is just the same way for those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who have no faith, who are lazy, who have no mindfulness, who are not concentrated, who are ignorant, and who are not skilled in methods.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di na dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen dang dge bsnyen ma kha cig 'dod chags med pa la 'dod chags kyi 'du shes bskyed nas /ğŸ”½'dod chags kyi 'jigs pas skrag ste 'dod chags las nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang med par zhe sdang gi 'du shes bskyed gti mug med par gti mug gi 'du shes bskyed nas gti mug gi 'jigs pas skrag ste /

translated: â€œSon of a good family, here some monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen, not having desire, generate the idea of desire,ğŸ”½and, frightened by the fear of desire, seek the escape from desire.ğŸ”½And likewise, not having hatred, they generate the idea of hatred, and, not having confusion, they generate the idea of confusion, and, frightened by the fear of confusion, seek the escape from confusion.

translated: Son of a good family, it is like this: for example, a person, because of superimposition on what is not there, generates the idea of fear in the absence of fear.

original: rigs kyi bu byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni 'dod chags kyi mtha' ma shes nas 'dod chags kyi yod pa'i mtha'i 'jigs pas skrag ste /

translated: Son of a good family, in the same way, childish ordinary beings, not knowing the end of desire, are frightened by the fear of the end of the existence of desire.

analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mtha' las nges par 'byung ba tshol lo //
translated: They seek liberation from the end of desire.

original: zhe sdang gi mtha' ci yang med pa'i mtha' ma shes nas zhe sdang gi mtha'i 'jigs pas skrag cing ci yang med pa'i mtha' la nges par 'byung bar yongs su tshol lo //

translated: Not knowing the end of hatred, the end of nothingness, they are frightened by the fear of the end of hatred. They seek liberation in the end of nothingness.

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtha' las nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol bar byed do //

translated: If things, actions, agents, and objects were established, then everything would be established, and so our assertion would be established.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:ğŸ”½Your contact is false,

original: khyod kyi reg pa 'di ni brdzun pa yin te /ğŸ”½ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis //
analyzed: khyod kyi reg pa 'di ni brdzun pa yin te / ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis //
translated: becauseğŸ”½the apprehender, the apprehended,

analyzed: gang gis 'dzin dang 'dzin gang dang / 'dzin pa po dang gang gzung ba //

translated: When the yogi does not observe error through the reasoning explained above,

original: de ltar phyin ci log ma dmigs pas de'i rgyu can gyi ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log ma dmigs pas de'i rgyu can gyi ma rig pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, in that way, through not observing error, ignorance that is its cause ceases.

original: de 'gags pas ma rig pa'i rgyu can 'du byed la sogs pa rga shi'i mthar thug pa'i chos rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'gags pas ma rig pa'i rgyu can 'du byed la sogs pa rga shi'i mthar thug pa'i chos rnams 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Through its cessation, phenomena that are caused by ignorance, such as formations, up to aging and death, cease.

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa'i tshogs mtha' dag dang / skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa'i tshogs mtha' dag dang / skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because ignorance is the cause of the entire mass of afflictions and of birth and so on, which are suffering.

original: ji ltar lus kyi dbang po'i rgyu can dbang po gzugs can thams cad ni lus @155b kyi dbang po 'gags pa na 'gag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi dbang po'i rgyu can dbang po gzugs can thams cad ni lus @155b kyi dbang po 'gags pa na 'gag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as all physical faculties that are caused by the body faculty cease when the body faculty ceases,

original: 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can srid pa'i yan lag 'byung ba rnams ni nges par ma rig pa 'gags pa na 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs pa ma rig pa'i rgyu can srid pa'i yan lag 'byung ba rnams ni nges par ma rig pa 'gags pa na 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in the same way, it is taught that the arising of the limbs of existence that are caused by ignorance, such as formations, definitely cease when ignorance ceases.

original: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //
analyzed: ma rig 'gags par gyur na ni //
translated: When ignorance ceases,

original: 'du byed la sogs 'gag par 'gyur //ğŸ”½zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed la sogs 'gag par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The formations and so on cease.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

original: gal te phyin ci log 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag na /ğŸ”½'o na ni gang zhig de ltar phyin ci log 'gags pas 'gag par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te phyin ci log 'gags pas ma rig pa 'gag na / 'o na ni gang zhig de ltar phyin ci log 'gags pas 'gag par 'gyur ba /
translated: If ignorance ceases through the cessation of error,

original: ma rig pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yod pa yin te /
translated: then ignorance would exist,ğŸ”½because someone would seek a means to stop error in that way.

original: nam mkha'i aa mra'i lcug ma yod pa ma yin pa spang ba'i thabs tshol ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i aa mra'i lcug ma yod pa ma yin pa spang ba'i thabs tshol ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that someone seeks a means to stop the nonexistence of an imaginary figment, like the nonexistent mango tree in the sky.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, ignorance exists,

original: de 'gag pa'i thabs tshol ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gag pa'i thabs tshol ba yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa de'i rgyu can rnams yod pa yin la //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa de'i rgyu can rnams yod pa yin la //
translated: Therefore, the afflictions such as attachment, which have it as their cause, exist.

original: nyon mongs pa yod pa'i phyir srid pa'i rgyun yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yod pa'i phyir srid pa'i rgyun yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: And because the afflictions exist, the continuum of existence also exists.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /

original: kye ma gang zhig dam pa gzhan gyi don 'byung ba la ci la yang rag ma las par ches pa rnams thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i dug gi ljon shing chen po bdag nyid thams cad du sdug bsngal shin tu stobs pa ma lus
analyzed: kye ma gang zhig dam pa gzhan gyi don 'byung ba la ci la yang rag ma las par ches pa rnams thabs dang shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i dug gi ljon shing chen po bdag nyid thams cad du sdug bsngal shin tu stobs pa ma lus
translated: Alas! Those who are confident in the benefit of others, who are not dependent on anything, and who by the power of method and wisdom uproot the great poisonous tree of the afflictions in all its entirety, completely uprooting all the great power of suffering,

original: pa drungs 'byin par mdzad pa la /
analyzed: pa drungs 'byin par mdzad pa la /

analyzed: stobs 'debs par mi gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang de drungs 'byin par mdzad pa rnams dang shin tu 'gal bar gnas shing gzu lums kyi nyon mongs pa'i dug gi ljon shing chen po de 'dzugs pa la ches shin tu gus pa ni /

analyzed: pha rol po don ma yin pa la mkhas pa shin tu chen po nyid yin no //

original: gzhan yang gal te nyon mongs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams spong ba yod na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te nyon mongs pa ma rig pa la sogs pa rnams spong ba yod na ni /
translated: Moreover, if the afflictions such as ignorance were to be abandoned,

original: de dag spong ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag spong ba ni yod pa ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: @156a * // 'di ltar /
analyzed: @156a * // 'di ltar /

analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang / gzugs kyis kyang ni byang chub bstan //
translated: The noble King of SamÄdhis SÅ«tra also says:ğŸ”½Form is taught to be awakening.

translated: are called â€œsufferingâ€ because they are by nature a calamity, since they are not in harmony with the three kinds of suffering: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

analyzed: de ltar dngos po de dag gis dngos po de dag nyid der dmigs pa'i phyir rims la sogs pa'i nad kyis btab pas dbang po phyin ci log tu gyur pa bu ram mngar ba'i rang bzhin yang kha ba nyid du dmigs pa rnams la de dag gi shes pa la ltos nas kha ba nyid du bden gyi /
translated: In dependence on their consciousness, it is true that the shell is yellow,ğŸ”½but it is not true that it is white.

original: mngar ba nyid du ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mngar ba nyid du ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, although the five appropriated aggregates are by nature suffering,

original: de lta na yang gang dag gis 'di dag sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du mthong ba de dag nyid la de dag sdug bsngal yin par bzhag gi //
analyzed: de lta na yang gang dag gis 'di dag sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du mthong ba de dag nyid la de dag sdug bsngal yin par bzhag gi //
translated: still, they are posited as suffering only for those who see them as having the nature of suffering.

original: phyin ci log dang rjes su 'brel bas rnam pa gzhan du dmigs pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang rjes su 'brel bas rnam pa gzhan du dmigs pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not posited as suffering for those whose faculties are impaired by the error of ignorance, for whom the aggregates appear in a form that is different from the way they actually exist.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kho na la de sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du bden pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kho na la de sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid du bden pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of suffering for only noble beings, and thus it is called the noble truth of suffering.

original: gal te 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang tshor ba sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar yongs su gcod pa nyid ma yin nam ;
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang tshor ba sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar yongs su gcod pa nyid ma yin nam ;
translated: But donâ€™t non-noble beings also discern the suffering of feeling as suffering?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar sdug bsngal 'phags pa rnams kho na la bden pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar sdug bsngal 'phags pa rnams kho na la bden pa yin zhe na /
translated: So how can suffering be a truth for only noble beings?

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal nyid 'ba' zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal nyid 'ba' zhig sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma yin te /
translated: The truth of suffering is not just the suffering of feeling.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga char yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga char yin no //
translated: It is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kho na la de bden pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa rnams kho na la de bden pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called a noble truth because it is a truth for only noble beings.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: lag mthil spu nyag gcig 'dug pa //
analyzed: lag mthil spu nyag gcig 'dug pa //
translated: A single hair on the palm of the hand

original: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
translated: is not felt by people,

original: de nyid mig tu song na yang //
analyzed: de nyid mig tu song na yang //

analyzed: mi bde ba dang gnod bskyed ltar //
translated: It is like a thorn in the foot.

original: byis pa lag mthil 'dra ba yis //
analyzed: byis pa lag mthil 'dra ba yis //
translated: The childish, like the palm,

analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal @157b spu mi rtogs //

original: 'phags pa mig dang 'dra bas ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa mig dang 'dra bas ni //
translated: The noble ones, like the eye,

analyzed: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung // zhes bshad do //
translated: are very sensitive to it.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal de ni 'phags pa rnams kho na la bden pas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal de ni 'phags pa rnams kho na la bden pas sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, since that suffering is true only for the noble ones, it is established as the noble truth of suffering.

original: nam zhig gi tshe na 'di sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par rigs she na /
analyzed: nam zhig gi tshe na 'di sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden par rigs she na /
translated: At what time is it reasonable to call it the noble truth of suffering?

original: gang gi tshe 'dus byas rnams la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dus byas rnams la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa yin na /
translated: When conditioned things have arising and destruction.

original: gang gi tshe stong pa'i phyir cung zad kyang skye ba med cing cung zad kyang 'gag pa med pa de'i tshe ni sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa'i phyir cung zad kyang skye ba med cing cung zad kyang 'gag pa med pa de'i tshe ni sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When nothing arises and nothing ceases because of emptiness, then suffering does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal med pa na yang kun 'byung gi bden pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa na yang kun 'byung gi bden pa yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: And if suffering does not exist, how could the truth of origination exist?

original: 'di ltar rgyu gang las sdug bsngal kun 'byung zhing skye ba sred pa dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu de la ni kun 'byung zhes bya na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu gang las sdug bsngal kun 'byung zhing skye ba sred pa dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rgyu de la ni kun 'byung zhes bya na /
translated: Thus, the cause from which suffering arises is called origination. The cause has the characteristic of craving, karma, and affliction.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu dang bral ba rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir kun 'byung yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bur gyur pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe 'bras bu dang bral ba rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir kun 'byung yang med do //
translated: When the effect, the truth of suffering, does not exist, then origination does not exist, because it is untenable that a cause exists without an effect.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral zhing yid mi skye ba la ni 'gog pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral zhing yid mi skye ba la ni 'gog pa zhes bya na /
translated: The cessation of suffering and the nonarising of the mind is called cessation.

original: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal nyid med pa de'i tshe gang gang gis 'gog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sdug bsngal nyid med pa de'i tshe gang gang gis 'gog par 'gyur /
translated: When suffering does not exist, then by what would cessation occur?

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the cessation of suffering does not exist.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal med na 'gog pa'i bden pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal med na 'gog pa'i bden pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, if suffering does not exist, the truth of cessation also does not exist.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa med na yang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyang yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa med na yang sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyang yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the cessation of suffering does not exist, then how could the noble path, the eightfold path that goes to the cessation of suffering, exist?

original: de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam gyi bden pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, the truth of the path does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po rnams stong par smra bar khyod la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po rnams stong par smra bar khyod la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for you who advocate that things are empty, the four noble truths would not exist.

original: de las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of that?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med pas //
translated: Because the four noble truths do not exist,ğŸ”½Complete understanding, abandonment,

original: yongs su shes dang spang ba dang // sgom dang mngon du bya ba dag /'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su shes dang spang ba dang // sgom dang mngon du bya ba dag /'thad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Meditation, and realization are not tenable.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams med par thal ba yin dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni rnam pa dag gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa de dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung gi bden pa spang ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam sgom pa dang //ğŸ”½sdug bsngal 'gog pa mngon du bya ba ste mngon sum @158a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams med par thal ba yin dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni rnam pa dag gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa de dang / sdug bsngal kun 'byung gi bden pa spang ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam sgom pa dang // sdug bsngal 'gog pa mngon du bya ba ste mngon sum @158a * //
translated: Because the four noble truths do not exist, complete understanding of the truth of suffering by way of its aspects such as impermanence, abandonment of the truth of the origin of suffering, meditation on the truth of the path that is the way to the cessation of suffering,

original: du bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: du bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: and realization of the cessation of suffering are not tenable.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pas yongs su shes pa la sogs pa med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pas yongs su shes pa la sogs pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the four noble truths such as suffering do not exist, then the thorough understanding of suffering and so on would not exist.

original: nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the error in that?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is this:

original: de dag yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: de dag yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: Since they do not exist,

original: 'bras bu bzhi yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi yang yod ma yin //
translated: The four fruits do not exist.

original: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
translated: If the fruits do not exist, then those who enjoy the fruits do not exist.

original: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //
translated: Those who enter the fruits also do not exist.

original: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //
translated: If these eight types of person

analyzed: de dag med na dge 'dun med //
translated: Do not exist, then the Saá¹…gha does not exist.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med phyir //

original: dam pa'i chos kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang yod ma yin //
translated: The sublime Dharma also does not exist.

original: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na ;
analyzed: chos dang dge 'dun yod min na ;
translated: If the Dharma and Saá¹…gha do not exist,

original: ; sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: ; sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //

analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la sogs pa med pa de'i tshe /
translated: When suffering and so on are not thoroughly understood and so on,

original: de med pas rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / bzhi yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pas rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / bzhi yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the four fruits of stream-enterer, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat are also untenable.

analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / 'dir nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spangs pa bsdoms pas ni /
translated: How so?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: kun tu sbyor ba gsum spangs pas skad cig ma bcu drug pa lam la rjes su shes pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i spangs pa gang yod pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //

translated: the fruit of stream-enterer is the abandonment of the defilements that exist on the sixteenth moment of cognition, such as subsequent cognition of the path, and so on, through abandoning the three fetters.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i rnam pa rnams la yang re re zhing chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i dbye bas phye ba na rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i rnam pa rnams la yang re re zhing chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i dbye bas phye ba na rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: The defilements of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are divided into nine classes through dividing each of the great, medium, and small defilements into great, medium, and small.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam pa drug pa zad pas rnam par grol pa'i lam la spangs pa gang yod pa de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam pa drug pa zad pas rnam par grol pa'i lam la spangs pa gang yod pa de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The abandonment that exists on the path of liberation by the exhaustion of the sixth type of affliction of the desire realm is the result of once-returner.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag gi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu pa zad pas rnam par grol ba'i lam la spangs ba gang zhig yod pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //ğŸ”½gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang par bya ba /

translated: The abandonment that exists on the path of liberation by the exhaustion of the ninth type of affliction of the desire realm is the result of non-returner.

original: sa dang sa la rnam pa dgu'i dbye bas phye ba rnams las 'du shes med 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyis pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu zad par zad pas rnam par grol ba'i lam la spangs pa gang zhig yod pa de ni
analyzed: sa dang sa la rnam pa dgu'i dbye bas phye ba rnams las 'du shes med 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyis pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu zad par zad pas rnam par grol ba'i lam la spangs pa gang zhig yod pa de ni
translated: The abandonment that exists on the path of liberation by the exhaustion of the ninth type of affliction of the form and formless realms to be abandoned by the path of meditation

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu zhes @158b bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu zhes @158b bya ste /
translated: is the result of arhatship.

original: 'di dag ni 'bras bu bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'bras bu bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four results.

original: 'di dag ji ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar rigs she na /
translated: How are they appropriate?ğŸ”½If there were complete understanding of suffering, abandonment of the source,

original: gal te sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yod cing kun 'byung spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang lam sgom pa yod par 'gyur ba yin na /ğŸ”½gang gi tshe sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pas sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa la sogs pa med pa de'i tshe ni 'bras bu bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin no //ğŸ”½'bras bu bzhi po de dag med na de dag la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i gang zag 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang yod pa ma yin no //
